Crimes.Violation_Type: Immigration violation - overstaying authorized period of stay
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant meets the tri-partite test for a stay of removal
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant failed to provide new evidence in PRRA application; previous refugee claim and spousal sponsorship were denied
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending judicial review
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Motion dismissed due to failure to meet tri-partite test
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant and sponsored partner applicant
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada beyond authorized period and after final removal order
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged need for protection based on PRRA submission
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test: (1) serious issue to be tried, (2) irreparable harm, (3) balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Lack of new evidence and absence of individualized risk evidence
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to PRRA and removal orders
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Filing of motion for stay of removal following PRRA refusal
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness and correctness as applicable to administrative decisions
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No explicit finding; lack of new evidence undermined credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Used: PRRA application package, prior refugee hearing record, country condition reports
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 112 and 114 of IRPA regarding removal orders and stays
Crimes.Application_Basis: Judicial review of PRRA decision and request for equitable relief
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Interim stay of removal to allow for full judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Tri-partite test established in Canadian case law for stays
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to present new, compelling evidence in PRRA application
Crimes.Outcome: Removal order upheld; no stay granted
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Generalized claims of hardship without proof of irreparable harm
Crimes.Cause_Description: Denial of refugee claim and spousal sponsorship leading to enforceable removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed submitted PRRA materials and found them insufficient
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 117(1) of IRPA – obligation to leave Canada after removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No new or credible evidence presented to justify stay
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant with immigration status post-removal order
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Submissions deemed inadequate to meet legal threshold for stay
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious issue raised, no irreparable harm shown, balance of convenience favors enforcement
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to demonstrate risk or grounds for relief

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Violation_Type: Willful non-compliance with a final removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant meets the tri-partite test for a stay of removal
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant sought delay of removal to Guyana after unsuccessful refugee and PRRA claims
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal to prevent deportation
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Motion dismissed; removal order remains enforceable
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national with final removal order
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Attempted to delay lawful removal through judicial process without new evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Request for reconsideration of PRRA decision and humanitarian considerations
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Tri-partite test: (1) serious issue to be tried, (2) irreparable harm, (3) balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: No public interest in delaying removal; decision aligned with immigration enforcement goals
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, particularly provisions on removal orders and stays
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Motion for stay filed in conjunction with application for judicial review
Crimes.Review_Standard: Correctness and reasonableness standards applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No enhancement of credibility through new evidence or arguments
Crimes.Evidence_Used: PRRA decision, judicial review records, procedural history
Crimes.Application_Basis: Challenge to lawfulness of PRRA decision and request for equitable relief
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Existing administrative record; no additional evidence submitted
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Interim stay to halt removal pending further review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Tri-partite test for granting interlocutory relief in immigration cases
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Absence of new evidence or demonstration of unique harm
Crimes.Outcome: Stay denied; removal permitted to proceed
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: General consequences of deportation not sufficient to establish irreparable harm
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refusal of refugee protection and PRRA leading to enforceable removal
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court relied on existing administrative record; no oral evidence taken
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 117(1) IRPA – duty to comply with removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to adduce evidence meeting the threshold for stay
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant with immigration status and removal directive
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction over immigration and refugee matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Record found insufficient to justify equitable intervention
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious issue, no irreparable harm, public interest favors enforcement
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of material, credible, and probative evidence to support stay
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Tri-partite test for interlocutory relief in immigration context
